definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
to stand in a circle and watch
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure

sentences.english: Non -stress test has a higher clinical value in foretelling perinatal prognosis ofp olyhydramnios.
sentences.chinese: 無激惹試驗在其預測圍生兒預後具有較好的臨牀價值。

sentences.english: At the brand new Starbucks store a long queue of people spilled onto the street.
sentences.chinese: 人們把嶄新的星巴克大門圍得水泄不通。

sentences.english: Debate of the two people to play up, drew a group of reporters to surround pat.
sentences.chinese: 爭論中兩人打了起來，引來了一羣記者的圍拍。

sentences.english: Students eat huddled around makeshift coal burners for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 學生們圍在煤爐旁邊喫飯邊取暖。

sentences.english: We boxed the house and garden in with fences.
sentences.chinese: 我們用柵欄把房子和花園圍了起來。

sentences.english: Objective To study the role of the overall deli very monitoring in decreasing the case mortality rate of perinatal children.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討分娩全程監護在降低圍生兒病死率中的作用。

sentences.english: Objective To sum up the experiences of simultaneous kidney-pancreas transplantation (SKPT) with enteric drainage of pancreatic secretion (ED).
sentences.chinese: 目的總結腸腔引流式胰腎聯合移植圍手術期處理經驗。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the effect of the use of continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion(CSII) in diabetic patients in paraoperation period.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察胰島素泵在糖尿病患者圍手術期應用的益處。

sentences.english: That the earth circles about the sun once is called a year.
sentences.chinese: 地球圍太陽轉一圈稱爲一年。

sentences.english: Then they huddle around the kitchen hearth waiting for the first dawn of the bright New Year.
sentences.chinese: 他們在除夕也要大掃除，然後一家人圍在爐邊守歲。

sentences.english: Tom wears a belt round his waist.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆腰裏圍了一根皮帶。

sentences.english: Conclusion:Scientific peri-operative care for patients may enhance the success rate of operation and reduce complications.
sentences.chinese: 科學的圍手術期護理可提高手術成功率，減少併發症。

sentences.english: So head out and take note of the nearest supermarket, pharmacy, post office, library, etc.
sentences.chinese: 走出去，記下週圍的超市，藥店，郵局，圖書館等等。

sentences.english: The birth defects monitoring data in Anhui Tongcheng Hospital from May. 1988 to Mar. 1989 were studied.
sentences.chinese: 對安徽桐城縣醫院圍產兒出生缺陷監測進行分析。

sentences.english: "How?"The others all rounded to come over.
Eventually, she and her sister came out and gathered around the pool.
sentences.chinese: 最後，比和她妹妹終於從房間裏出來圍在池子旁邊。

definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
